alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 12:01PM PDT until November 05 at 8:55PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .The heavy rain has come to an end early Saturday morning. The Cowlitz River at Randle has crested and will continue to recede. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...covering nearby farm lands and several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM PDT Saturday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...The river crested this morning late this morning. And will continue to recede. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 800 PM PDT.
